replies.bodyText:
@paususe As @Loquacity wrote: the doc issues are tracked like "development" issues (which we also link in the upstream PRs). I agree that this is a bit unhandy for external contributors, so maybe we could rephrase the instructions a bit:
(For SUSE Manager contributors): [Documentation issue](url) was created.
Would it make more sense?
From my own experience I can say that not having such url in the template leads to (even more) forgetting to address the documentation.
replies.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText: External contributors can use the "report an issue" link in the Resources menu of the docs, which opens an issue in the Uyuni docs repo. I see them there, and create a duplicate in the Spacewalk repo for us to track. Either way, we have a process to handle them, and I'm not sure we need to cover every edge case in this template.
replies.author: Loquacity
paususe

replies.bodyText:
External contributors can use the "report an issue" link in the Resources menu...

But the purpose of the link in the template is to suggest the contributors to create a doc issue together with their PR. They don't know, that they need to go to the Resources menu.

What about something like this? Documentation issue for [Uyuni]...

I think that stating "issue for uyuni OR issue for suma" is a bit confusing: for a SUMA devel, it's not absolutely clear whether they should create suma or uyuni issues. I made this clear in my latest commit: suma devels create suma issues, community devels create uyuni issues.
